subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ahhh the infamous Fish!
author: black bear hollow
full_text:
I just said that in reference to Al's comments. There are a cluster of  
researchers who insist on tagging religious myth on research...  
angels, devils, heaven, hell, assuming anything visiting our plane is  
"stuck" and needs "saving" and ignoring other energies assuming  
everything they hear is or was a human mortal.

Yes, I've heard from many energies claiming to be many things and some  
never having inhabited a body.

Wisteria
On Aug 17, 2008, at 9:45 PM, Lisby wrote:

> I said that because all of the examples I heard of EVP by the Fish  
> Group has sounded very human and they have never claimed to have  
> been other than human that I have heard. I have to base my  
> conclusions on the EVP files, not speculation, even from the  
> victims. Do you know of instances where they audibly claimed to be  
> nonhuman? I may have missed them--I heard a lot of EVPs from them,  
> but certainly not the sum total. (As I said--I even got one myself  
> the other day.)
>
> I think you're right that they are definitely mobile, and a  
> collective.
>
> Ann


I jus said ha in e e ence o Al's commen s. I ha e o base my conclusions on he EVP iles, no specula ion, e en om he ic ims. Do you know o ins ances whe e hey audibly claimed o be nonhuman? I may ha e missed hem--I hea d a lo o EVPs om hem, bu ce ainly no he sum o al. (As I said--I e en go one mysel he o he day.)I hink you' e igh ha hey a e de ini ely mobile, and a collec i e.Ann
